alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 8:53PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Albany, northwestern Laramie and southwestern Platte Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 853 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Iron Mountain, or 19 miles northeast of Laramie, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chugwater, Iron Mountain, Baldy Peak and Slater. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 36 and 56, and between mile markers 62 and 65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
